oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Camp Morton by Charles Ward
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Writing to his mother from Camp Morton in Indianapolis, British subject Ward says "to give my love to all the boys and girls in pertickler and tell that girl that I send her a kiss this long/--------------/." Having fought for the Union in the Civil War as a British subject, he became a naturalized American citizen in Indiana in 1866. Ward served in the 60th Ind. Vol. Inf. Regt., USA.
